jd: From: abhinav, wise equation abhinav.c@wiseq.net Reply to: abhinav.c@wiseq.net AWS Cloud Engineers (L1/L2). Start date is ASAP and will last for 1 YEAR+. prefer local to Dallas but it’s not a hard requirement. They can be remote if not on site, but some travel may need to occur and in that case expenses would be covered.Must be a USC. Skills (EXPERT/ADVANCED/NONE):AWS Cloud EngineerAzureGCPDescription: We are seeking strong AWS Cloud Engineers with prior Operations experience to join our talented team of Global Cloud Operations. We can support the entire cloud services life cycle for enterprise level organizations, delivering some of the world’s largest automated solutions for secure, hyperscale, cloud infrastructure migration and management. Our solutions allow data-driven businesses to unlock the elasticity and price-performance benefits of Cloud Service Providers (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc) and our experts deliver cloud and as-a-service expertise, extensive security DNA, big data, IoT and predictive analytics and machine learning expertise, so you can expect to work with the coolest technologies every day. Responsibilities• Work with the customer and architect on maintaining Virtual Private Cloud VPC environments, including compute, storage, database, networking, security etc. in the AWS ecosystem• Act as Tier 1/2 Support Engineer for the most common & newly announced AWS components and services• Act as Technical POC for customers.• Deploy/Manage AWS environments including VPN solutions between regions and subnets• Manage AWS architecture including the development of machine templates and blueprints• Deploy and implement systems infrastructure projects and maintaining the Cloud environments based on customer requirements• Validation to ensure that the environment meets all security and compliance controls• Leveraging written and verbal communication skills to work directly with customers• Creating knowledge articles and run books for solutions developed Required Skills & ExperienceOpen to available 24/7 support• Positive attitude should be able to adapt and work based on business demand.• Good working knowledge of AWS• Working knowledge of Configuration Management (Ansible) Continuous Integration Tools (gitlab)• Prior experience provisioning and spinning up Kubernetes Clusters and managing Kubernetes installations• Hands on Terraform experience• Possession of excellent analytical and problem-solving skills• In depth knowledge of UNIX/Linux and Windows Environment• End to End configuration & trouble shooting of the web and application servers (Nginx, Apache, Tomcat, IIS)• Good written and verbal English communication• Production experience to build scalable systems (load balancers, memcached, master/slave architectures)• Experience supporting a managed services infrastructure (Public cloud)• Prior work with Cloud Monitoring and Devops tools (e.g. Dynatrace, ansible, gitlab, terraform, Palo Alto FW)• Experience with Docker, Kubernetes• Other tools used in the infrastructure space• Good to have AWSAssociate/SysOps/Developer Certification course levelMust be US Only Citizen
